intro: Gavilea kingii, commonly known as the King's gavilea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Gavilea kingii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
